data.title: Failing to get Urho set up as 'external library'
data.body:
http://urho3d.github.io/documentation/1.32/_using_library.html

(a) if the rake command really works, I think it should be the very first thing on the page! Not the last! :-)

(b) But... it doesn't seem to work for me. (Ubuntu 14.04 lts 32bit intel.) It does make a directory and set up files, symlinks, but then I can't get cmake to work. _I think this is probably because the process of using cmake correctly is still not clear to me: https://github.com/urho3d/Urho3D/issues/697_

$ rake scaffolding dir=MyTestApp

$ cd MyTestApp

$ mkdir build

$ ./cmake_generic.sh build

CMake Error at CMake/Modules/FindUrho3D.cmake:143 (message):
  Could not find Urho3D library in Urho3D build tree or SDK installation.
  Use URHO3D_HOME environment variable or build option to specify the
  location of the build tree or SDK installation.
Call Stack (most recent call first):
  CMakeLists.txt:28 (find_package)

-- Configuring incomplete, errors occurred!
See also "/w/x/y/z/Urho3D/MyTestApp/build/CMakeFiles/CMakeOutput.log".

$ pwd
/w/x/y/z/Urho3D/MyTestApp

$ ls bin
CoreData@  Data@

data.title: feature: support typed lua
data.body:
https://github.com/andremm/typedlua

It would be super keen to support Typed Lua.

data.title: build options documentation clarification desired
data.body:
http://urho3d.github.io/documentation/1.32/_building.html#Build_Options

I am guessing that the middle column that has the title "V" is the default value for the flag in the first column of that row? Overall I find it unclear. And confusing because then sometimes the default value is explained in the description in the 3rd column. 

If the middle column _is_ supposed to be the default, I will write up a p.r. to show what I hope might be a slightly more clear setup for the table in the docs.

data.title: cmake build is confusing / poorly documented
data.body:
(old thread: https://github.com/urho3d/Urho3D/pull/692)

Ok, seeking help. I need to understand how builds are expected to really happen. What I think I have heard / read from people here does not make sense vs. what I have seen happen on my machine in reality.

To wit: It sounds like people are saying that "1) mkdir build 2) cd build 3) ../cmake_generic.sh . 4) make" is expected to Do The Right Thing vs. only doing 3 & 4, in the local git repo root directory.

But it doesn't really work right. Because I end up with localrepo/build/bin that does not contain the stuff in localrepo/bin, so the localrepo/build/bin directory is incomplete & not usable.

data.title: add table of contents to some doc pages.
Spotlights are broken on Intel HD GPU, Windows, OpenGL 3
data.body:
The 07_Billboards example shows artifacts in the spotlights, both forward and deferred, in GL3 mode. GL2 is fine.

Examine whether this can be circumvented without breaking anything else, and without making the shader code ugly or nonsensical.

data.title: table of contents for documentation
data.body:
Pages like http://urho3d.github.io/documentation/HEAD/_building.html are long and have several sections. I think an improvement would be to have a table of contents at the top of the page, with links to the sections. This allows for (a) easier navigation and (b) easier deep linking.

(An alternative -- much like code -- is to break the long pages into smaller individual pages, one per sub-section, and link out to those from the 'master' page.)

data.title: documentation re: Native build process & makefile
data.body:
Hi, I'd like the docs to explain if/how we can use make, rather than e.g. Eclipse, on Linux.
http://urho3d.github.io/documentation/HEAD/_building.html
under "Native build process"

data.title: Slight usability improvement of cmake shell scripts.
data.body: When I tried to run the script, I found it confusing & the online docs didn't really clarify it well. I had to look into the scripts themselves to see what was expected. So I'm trying to improve that a little bit.

data.body:
$ sudo dpkg -i Urho3D-1.32-Linux-SHARED.deb 
[sudo] password for x:

Errors were encountered while processing:
 Urho3D-1.32-Linux-SHARED.deb

data.title: [Feature Request] Purge work queue by stringhash
data.body: Add the ability to purge selected items from a work queue.  A string hash came to mind as a natural fit.

data.title: Expose ParticleEffect constructor/destructor to Lua script.
data.body:
To better allow for procedurally constructing particle effects rather than simply loading from XML.

Also, expose AddColorTime and AddTextureTime for easier setting of keyframes through code.

data.title: Mainly added Node transformative function overloads
data.body:
Mainly added Node transformative function overloads in the header file.
Also removed a pair of round brackets that seemed obsolete in Object.h.

data.title: Mainly added Node transformative function overloads
data.body:
Added several overloads for position, rotation and scale setters.
Also removed a pair of seemingly functionless round brackets over at the ObjectFactory.

data.title: Editor Copy/Paste CollisionShape Doesn't Update Transforms
data.body: Editor copy/paste of a CollisionShape doesn't update its transforms unless you move the parent node.

data.title: Text doesnt show in test 32
data.body:
In Urho2DContraints.cpp text is just white blocks  
(master branch).

data.title: [Editor] (feature request) Clone material button with auto assign
data.body:
Usually I prefer to create a new material it is fully based on std material like a "stone" and other materials. And in this case I picking the "stone" material to model then going to material inspector save this as copy, then again going to model's setup to pick this new saved material then do some color tweaks or something else.

Is it possible to create the "Clone" button for this? 
Maybe with dialog window for enter the new name of cloned material 
![123](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/9577466/6830838/c164c528-d346-11e4-9329-f781929eaa24.png)

data.title: Bug with OpenGL 3.2 and post-process shaders usage
data.body:
Hello, 

When i try to add a post process effect that relies on "PostProcess.glsl" usage i get this error:

global function texture3D is removed after version 140

The line that trigger this error is located in "PostProcess.glsl" at line 72.

data.title: Editor Unresponsive After Setting Window UIElement To Modal
data.body:
Editor Unresponsive After Setting Window UIElement To Modal
I would also like to point out that it would be nice if the other UIElement's had a modal option.

data.title: Slider doesn't get focused?
Render refactor
data.body:
- Adds D3D11 support (-DURHO_D3D11=1)
- Adds OpenGL3 support. This is dynamically detected at runtime, falls back to GL2 if not available
- Various rendering performance optimizations
- The half-pixel UV offset required by D3D9 only can be queried from Graphics, instead of using ifdef.
- OpenGL matrix multiplications are reversed to allow uploading uniforms without transpose
- On desktop APIs 8 continuous texture units are available for materials
- D3D9 SM 2.0 support is removed due to testing difficulty

Testing is welcome. When testing on D3D, you may need to delete all existing cached shaders from bin/CoreData/Shaders/HLSL/Cache, to ensure that shaders get recompiled.

Closes #270.

data.title: [DebugRenderer] AddSphere with new sphere shape
Node->SetEnabled(false), Animated2DSprite Compoenent Still Visible
data.body: Disabling a node will not make it's Animated2DSprite component invisible.  The saved scene file even says that the node is disabled.

data.title: [Editor] (fix to camera in ortho view: change translation to zoom usage )
data.body:
I guess that the camera translate from front or back  is not helpful in ortho view
in this case maybe it will be better if camera use the zoom and not translate ?

i'm change this and it now works well

FILE: EditorView.as 
PROC: void UpdateView(float timeStep)

LINE 1226                  if (mouseWheelCameraPosition && !camera.orthographic)

and i think that somehow needed to avoid transfer the zoom value from ortho view to perspective view 
mb reset it always in prespective view to = 1.0 :)

data.title: Default font invisible at certain font sizes
data.body: I noticed that when using the default font: "Anonymous Pro", it is invisible at sizes: [ 36, 47, 48, 72 ]. The other font BlueHighway doesn't seem to do such thing as in it seems to always be visible on all sizes at least when I scrolled all the font sizes inside the editor from 1 to 96.

data.title: Depth tested debug geometry does not work on OpenGL + deferred + postprocesses
data.body: If running on OpenGL with deferred renderpath, and postprocesses are enabled, depth-tested debug geometry will not render correctly, as it is seemingly using a different depth buffer than in the scene render.

data.title: Import empty nodes in AssetImporter scene mode
data.body:
Importing empty nodes in AssetImporter would allow defining game logic related nodes, for example spawn points. These will not contain any components however, so the only information imported is the node name, hierarchy and transform.

The behavior should be possible to disable with a command line option.

data.title: Examine converting terrain to btBvhTriangleMeshShape
data.body: Terrain collisions are jumpy at triangle edges due to using the heightfield shape. Check whether using the BVH triangle mesh shape instead (+ internal edge utility) solves this, and retains acceptable performance.

data.title: Urho3D Wiki
data.body: It would be cool to have an open wiki devoted to Urho3D. It would provide a place to consolidate community information into one place -- e.g. tutorials and other things. The GitHub wiki on this repo would be ideal for this.
